frontend-desc: I've been working on the frontend since 2018, commercially since 2021. I've spent most of my adventure writing code in React, but I'm not afraid to get my hands dirty writing Vue
Similar situation is with CSS when I've start using pure CSS, Boostrap and CSS-in-JS. And now I'm writing css mainly in tailwind
projects-subname: GUI for a system that searches for skin lesions in patients
project-desc: A few months after starting work, for 2 years
Managing maps, creating large dynamic forms, working with websocket and grapthql, first steps in SSR
Deeper SSR management, creating charts, fetching data from inconvenient (HTML) sources
Creating fullstack applications, managing binaries, dealing with tools popular in Gov applications
Advanced use of ServerFunction, Advanced use of charts, Creating pdfs with puppeteer
Learning the basics of working with external Git and baremetal Linux
Using bootstrap, working with a team, heavy use of state management
Lead frontend developer of the second wave
Working with electron. Repairing and modernizing a project in poor technical condition
